docs.snippet: In the absence of anything more definite, we are gratified to be able to announce, on the authority of Mr. DE SAUTY, the Chief Electrician at Trinity Bay, that the Atlantic Cable is positively not broken. He declines to make any statement for...
docs.lead_paragraph: In the absence of anything more definite, we are gratified to be able to announce, on the authority of Mr. DE SAUTY, the Chief Electrician at Trinity Bay, that the Atlantic Cable is positively not broken. He declines to make any statement for publication other than this, and that there are only temporary difficulties of an electrical nature.

headline.main: THE STATEN ISLAND WAR.; Reception at Quarantine of the First Military Detachment. VIGILANT WATCHFULNESS OF THE POLICE. MIDNIGHT ORGIES OF THE REBELS. Obnoxious Persons Hung in Effigy.

docs.lead_paragraph: The monotony at Quarantine was suddenly disturbed on Thursday night about 9 o'clock, by tile appearance of a large mob in the streets of Tomp. kinsvillie, headed by a fife and drum. They marched down the main street, and halted opposite Burns' Hotel. The crowd carried with them the effigies of several obnoxious persons, which were labeled to represent Dr. JACOB LAFARGE, Ex-Assemblyman JOHN F. RAYMOND, Mrs. UHL,

headline.main: SLAVERY DISCUSSION.; The Brownlow and Pryne Debate at Philadelphia.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Philadelphia Evening Journal published full reports of the Slavery Discussion in progress in that city, between Person BROWNLOW, of Tennessee, and the Rev. ABRAM PRYNE, editor of the Central Reformer, in this State. The parties to the controversy are described as follows:

docs.snippet: The attempts which are now making to vindicate the law on Staten Island, the Governor's proclamation, the calling out of the military, the arrests, reports, affidavits, and what not, lose an immense deal of their importance in consideration of the...
docs.lead_paragraph: The attempts which are now making to vindicate the law on Staten Island, the Governor's proclamation, the calling out of the military, the arrests, reports, affidavits, and what not, lose an immense deal of their importance in consideration of the disagreeable probability that not one of the rioters will ever suffer any greater punishment for his offence titan he has suffered already.

headline.main: History of a Savannah Slaver--Cruise of the Brig Rawlins--Singular Developments--The King of the Gamblers.

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor of the New-York Times: The King of the Gamblers" in this place has lone to England, 'tis said to bet" his pile" upon Mr. TENBRONCK'S horses. There are two tolerably good and comfortable hotels here. The one at which your correspondent " holds out," the Pulaski, is said to be the best. It is about on a par with the secondrate houses in New-York.

docs.snippet: The work inside the Quarantine inclosure continues to progress rapidly. The office of the Boarding Officer is completed, and business goes on with its accustomed regularity. The shanties for the sick are also half ready for use, A new boat-house is...

headline.main: THE STATEN ISLAND WAR.; Determination to Rebuild the Hospitals. Important Meeting of the Commissioners or Emigration. IMPLICATION OF MORE PERSONS IN THE ARSON, Arrangements for Encamping the Military. AFFAIRS AT QUARANTINE YESTERDAY.

docs.lead_paragraph: The work inside the Quarantine inclosure continues to progress rapidly. The office of the Boarding Officer is completed, and business goes on with its accustomed regularity. The shanties for the sick are also half ready for use, A new boat-house is now about completed near the site of the former one.

docs.snippet: BOARD OF ALDERMEE.--Alderman JOHN CLANOY, President, in the Chair. [The Aldermen met in their old room, which has been refitted in excellent style. The reporters table is better situated.

docs.snippet: The Journal de St. Petersbourg publishes the text of an important Imperialukase, relative to the measures in progress for the gradual abolition of serfdom throughout the Russian Empire.

headline.main: ST. PETERSBURG.; The Decrees Abolishing Serfdom--the Climate--Russian Soldiers--The Imperial Guard--Summer Resorts of the Nobles--The Waters of Slaviansk--An Unperformed Opera by Haydn--A Gift from Alexander Dumas--Visit from the French Emperor.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Journal de St. Petersbourg publishes the text of an important Imperialukase, relative to the measures in progress for the gradual abolition of serfdom throughout the Russian Empire.

docs.snippet: The American and Republican Conventions failed to effect a union yesterday, and separate tickets have been nominated, Immediately on the assembling of the Republican Convention, a motion was made to proceed to nominate, viva voce, candidates for...
docs.lead_paragraph: The American and Republican Conventions failed to effect a union yesterday, and separate tickets have been nominated, Immediately on the assembling of the Republican Convention, a motion was made to proceed to nominate, viva voce, candidates for Governor and all other State Officers to be supported by the Republican Party.

docs.snippet: BROOKLYN BOARD OF HEALTH--NO YELLOW FEVER IN THE CITY.-A regular meeting of this Board was held yesterday afternoon. Present, Mayor POWELL, in the Chair, and Aldermen KALBFLEISCH and WHITNEY The minutes were read and approved.
docs.lead_paragraph: BROOKLYN BOARD OF HEALTH--NO YELLOW FEVER IN THE CITY.-A regular meeting of this Board was held yesterday afternoon. Present, Mayor POWELL, in the Chair, and Aldermen KALBFLEISCH and WHITNEY The minutes were read and approved.
